creator: kdevel@vogtner.de
text:
srclib/apr/configure checks for availability of dlopen by issuing

   gcc -o conftest -g -O2 -pthread -DLINUX -D_REENTRANT -D_GNU_SOURCE  conftest.c -lrt -lcrypt  -lpthread >&5

Using Centos 6.7 this test succeeds because libcrypt.so refers to libfreebl3.so (Mozilla NSS) which contains a Shared Library entry "libdl.so.2". This causes httpd to be not dynamically linked to libdl.so.2.

That httpd will not run on other Systems where libcrypt.so is not linked to NSS, e.g. Debian 8.

Workaround: Set LIBS=-ldl before configure
